titles.title: Providing for consideration of the joint resolution (H.J. Res. 4) proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States authorizing the Congress to prohibit the physical desecration of the flag of the United States.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 108-136, by Mr. Linder.

Rule provides for consideration of H.J. Res. 4 with 2 hours of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions. Measure will be considered read. A specified amendment is in order.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 54.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 255.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 6/3/2003--Passed House without amendment. (This measure has not been amended since it was introduced on June 2, 2003. The summary of that version is repeated here.)Sets forth the rule for the consideration of H.J. Res. 4 (prohibiting the physical desecration of the U.S. flag).
